content:
I read Mario's paper, The Type Theory of Lean. The content discussed in the paper pertains to Lean 3, but to what extent does it hold for Lean 4? Specifically, does the claim that the equiconsistency of ZFCω and Leanω holds also apply to Lean 4?

cc @Mario Carneiro

Without knowing the details, some changes to the theory are highlighted in Section 3.2 of Sebastian's Dissertation and others in the Mario's Lean4Lean paper. The latter in particular may contain an answer to your question.

@Marcus Rossel

Thank you. I read the paper of lean4lean, and it mentioned that "proofs in Lean 3 do not work as-is." I interpreted this to mean that consistency proofs in Lean 4 have not yet been established.
Asei Inoue has marked this topic as resolved.
@Asei Inoue where did you get that quote? I do not find it in the lean4lean paper, and it sounds like it is missing context

@Mario Carneiro

image.png

Sorry, I was looking at this part of the paper: "While most of the new features can be treated as mere abbreviations, nested inductive types and η for structures significantly impact the theory, and as a result the soundness proof from [6] is no longer directly applicable"
I don't think those two features present anything fundamentally new to the proof, but I won't really believe it until the formalization is completed

nested inductive types can be simulated using W types (similar to the existing simulation argument in the #leantt paper), and eta for structures can be handled in the confluence proof in a similar way to eta for functions
